connector.description: Expose webhook endpoints to receive push notifications for other Camel components.

camel.source.path.endpointUri.name: camel.source.path.endpointUri
camel.source.path.endpointUri.description: The delegate uri. Must belong to a component that supports webhooks.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.webhookAutoRegiste.name: camel.source.endpoint.webhookAutoRegister
camel.source.endpoint.webhookAutoRegiste.description: Automatically register the webhook at startup and unregister it on shutdown.

camel.source.endpoint.webhookBasePath.name: camel.source.endpoint.webhookBasePath
camel.source.endpoint.webhookBasePath.description: The first (base) path element where the webhook will be exposed. It's a good practice to set it to a random string, so that it cannot be guessed by unauthorized parties.

camel.source.endpoint.webhookComponentNa.name: camel.source.endpoint.webhookComponentName
camel.source.endpoint.webhookComponentNa.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the REST transport, such as netty-http.

camel.source.endpoint.webhookExternalUrl.name: camel.source.endpoint.webhookExternalUrl
camel.source.endpoint.webhookExternalUrl.description: The URL of the current service as seen by the webhook provider

camel.source.endpoint.webhookPath.name: camel.source.endpoint.webhookPath
camel.source.endpoint.webhookPath.description: The path where the webhook endpoint will be exposed (relative to basePath, if any)

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.webhook.bridgeErrorHandl.name: camel.component.webhook.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.webhook.bridgeErrorHandl.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.webhook.webhookAutoRegis.name: camel.component.webhook.webhookAutoRegister
camel.component.webhook.webhookAutoRegis.description: Automatically register the webhook at startup and unregister it on shutdown.

camel.component.webhook.webhookBasePath.name: camel.component.webhook.webhookBasePath
camel.component.webhook.webhookBasePath.description: The first (base) path element where the webhook will be exposed. It's a good practice to set it to a random string, so that it cannot be guessed by unauthorized parties.

camel.component.webhook.webhookComponent.name: camel.component.webhook.webhookComponentName
camel.component.webhook.webhookComponent.description: The Camel Rest component to use for the REST transport, such as netty-http.

camel.component.webhook.webhookExternalU.name: camel.component.webhook.webhookExternalUrl
camel.component.webhook.webhookExternalU.description: The URL of the current service as seen by the webhook provider

camel.component.webhook.webhookPath.name: camel.component.webhook.webhookPath
camel.component.webhook.webhookPath.description: The path where the webhook endpoint will be exposed (relative to basePath, if any)

camel.component.webhook.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.webhook.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.webhook.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.webhook.configuration.name: camel.component.webhook.configuration
camel.component.webhook.configuration.description: Set the default configuration for the webhook meta-component.
